meanings.definition: The trigonometric function that is equal to the ratio of the side adjacent to an acute angle in a right-angled triangle to the hypotenuse.
meanings.sent1: In trigonometry, we often use cosines to calculate angles in triangles.
meanings.sent2: The cosines of acute angles help us solve right-angled triangles.
meanings.sent3: Why did the triangle bring a gift to the party? Because it heard everyone loves cosines!
meanings.sent4: The cosines in trigonometry act like secret codes unlocking the mysteries of triangles.
meanings.sent5: The teacher used a fun song to help us remember how to find cosines in triangles.
